greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponent of highest power of 8 dividing n.
comment: This is the member g = 8 in the g-family of sequences, g integer >= 2, call it phi(g,n), n >= 1. In the Mahler reference, Lemma 2, pp. 6-7, this exponent is called f = -phi if g divides r = n (s = 1 there), and f = 0 if g does not divide r = n (s = 1 there).
reference: Kurt Mahler, p-adic numbers and their functions, 2nd ed., Cambridge University press, 1981
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65536
formula: n = 8^a(n)*m with a(n) nonnegative integer such that 8 does not divide m, for n >= 1.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 27 2014
